Dear Ms. Koziara:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth is not being supervised per the facilities internal policy while
on technology.
Additional Allegation: Youth A and Youth B had a sexual
encounter when staff were not supervising.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/25/2024.
Youth A reported she can use technology with restrictions as she is not
on privileges at the facility. Youth A reported she can watch tv, play
video games, and can use the house computer to download music.
Youth A reported there are website blocks at the facility, so youth are
not able to go on inappropriate websites or social media. Youth A
reported when she was able to use the house computer when she was
on privileges, staff would sit next to her and watch the screen. Youth A
reported staff started supervising her on the computer a few weeks ago
when it was found that she was going to websites online that she was
not supposed to. Youth A reported she did not want to talk about what
she was doing online that resulted in her needing to be supervised.
Youth A reported she is currently only able to call her workers and
attorney via phone. Youth A reported staff dial her phone calls, and she
has to be in the den when she makes phone calls. Youth A reported
one time about a month ago she had staff call her worker and she took
the phone to her bedroom while staff were in the office. Youth A hung
up the phone and called a boy from her bedroom. Youth A reported
since that incident, she is now supervised on her phone calls. Youth A
reported staff supervise the youth at the facility at all times. Youth A
reported if a staff needs to use the bathroom and they are the only staff
at the house, some staff have the youth go to their bedrooms. Youth A
was asked about staff using the bathroom on 12/26/2023. Youth A
reported she did not want to talk about it. Youth A reported all she
would say was something happened with her and Youth B and it was
the only time. Youth A reported she did not recall who the staff was and
that the staff was only gone twenty to thirty seconds.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/25/2024.
Youth B reported he is able to use his school laptop computer at the
facility. The rules for using his computer are only one hour of computer
use per each shift, he is not allowed to have his computer in his
bedroom, he can use his computer in the den or the basement with staff
supervising at all times. Youth B explained staff supervising as staff
watching his computer screen at all times when he is on his computer
for safety. Youth B reported staff watch all youth when they are on
computers. Youth B reported when he is at the facility he is always
supervised by staff when he is awake and outside his bedroom. Youth
A reported if one staff is working in the house and the staff needs to use
the bathroom, youth have to go into their bedrooms. Youth B reported
there has never been a time when staff needed to go to the bathroom
that he has not gone to his bedroom. Youth B was asked if there was a
2

time when he and Youth A were left alone in the living room. Youth B
reported “yes, Staff 1 needed to use the bathroom and went
downstairs”. Youth B reported Staff 1 was downstairs using the
bathroom for six minutes. Youth B did not want to talk anymore about
what happened when Staff 1 was in the bathroom. Youth B reported this
was the only time he has been left alone without staff supervision.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/25/2024.
Youth C reported she can use the facility laptop computer to
communicate via email with family, to download music, and play
YouTube videos at night to fall asleep. Youth C reported youth are not
allowed to have computers in their bedrooms and at night the computer
is in the hallway playing the YouTube videos that she listens to in order
to fall asleep. Youth C reported Youth A is not able to use computers
due to inappropriate computer use. Youth C reported youth can be in
the den with computers if they are not required to be monitored but the
computer screen has to face the camera system. If youth do not need
to be monitored on computers youth can also be in the main living area
as staff do not have to see the screen. Youth C reported Youth A is
always monitored by staff when she is on the computer and staff sit right
next to her to see what she is doing.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/25/2024.
Staff 1 reported Youth A no longer has computer privileges at the facility
and has not for approximately two weeks due to Youth A having
inappropriate communication on the computer. Staff 1 checked Youth
A’s computer approximately two weeks ago and found Youth A was
inappropriately communicating with boys about sexual activities. Staff 1
reported Youth A was having the inappropriate conversations on her
computer when she was at school as the information, he found had time
stamps showing it was during the school day. Staff 1 reported when
Youth A was previously able to use the computer that she was always
supervised while on it at the facility. Staff 1 described supervised as he
would sit right next to Youth A so he could see her computer screen and
what she was doing on it. Staff 1 reported he worked on 12/26/2023 with
Youth A and Youth B and was the only staff on second shift. Staff 1
reported there was a call in for the morning shift and the on-call worker
who was scheduled to work with him, came in and worked the morning
shift and so he was the only staff working the second shift. Staff 1
reported over the holidays at the facility it was like “working on an island
alone” as there were no staff working at the main office and minimal staff
at the two houses. Staff 1 reported he arrived to work at 3pm and both
Youth A and Youth B were at the house. Staff 1 reported the shift went
well and he had no concerns at the time. Staff 1 found out a few weeks
after that when he went to use the bathroom downstairs Youth A and
Youth B had a physical interaction and kissed. Staff 1 needed to use the
bathroom and went downstairs leaving Youth A and Youth B alone in
the living room. Staff 1 reported there was only one staff scheduled at
the house, so he did not have anyone to call to supervise the youth.
Staff 1 reported he had no concerns of Youth A and Youth B doing
anything inappropriate together when he went to the bathroom as to his
3

knowledge Youth A and Youth B “hated” each other. Staff 1 reported he
left Youth A and Youth B alone upstairs for approximately six minutes.
Staff 1 reported the facilities supervision policy is to have eyes on youth
at all times. Staff 1 reported he did not recall Youth A having the laptop
computer on 12/26/2023 when he went downstairs to use the bathroom.
Staff 1 reported he believed it was found after 12/26/2023 Youth A was
being inappropriate on the laptop. Staff 1 reported the facilities policy for
supervising youth on computers is to have eyes on the computer while
the youth is on it, and it is policy for all youth to be monitored on
computers.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/25/2024.
Staff 2 reported she caught Youth A on a telephone call with a boy one
time when she was working. Staff 2 reported there was
miscommunication amongst staff as there was a change where youth
were no longer allowed to have the telephone in their bedrooms, and
she was not aware. Youth A asked to call Foster Care Worker and Staff
2 dialed the phone number for Youth A and Youth A took the phone to
her bedroom. Staff 2 reported she felt like something was off, so she
called the on-call supervisor who informed her that youth were no longer
allowed to have the telephone in their bedrooms. Staff 2 went into
Youth A’s bedroom and addressed with Youth A how Youth A knew the
rules had changed that day and provided negative points for Youth A not
being honest. Staff 2 reported Youth A took the negative points well
which is out of character for Youth A. Staff 2 then asked to hear who
was on the phone at which time Youth A was telling the person on the
phone to say her workers name. Staff 2 asked the individual on the
phone their name and it was a male voice. Staff 2 ended the telephone
call. Staff 2 reported the protocol now for Youth A to have telephone
calls is to be in the den, staff dial the phone number and verify who they
call, then give the phone back to Youth A. Staff 2 did not know if the
phone call is supposed to be on speaker phone. Staff 2 reported Youth
A is no longer able to use the house laptop computer except to
download music and staff must watch Youth A do this. Staff 2 reported
Youth A has always had a higher level of monitoring when on the laptop
computer and staff are always right next to her watching what she is
doing where some other youth staff can just have a line of vision on the
computer screen. Staff 2 reported she has only worked one shift where
she was alone and used the bathroom while the youth were in therapy.
Staff 2 reported if there is one staff on shift and the staff needs to use
the bathroom then the youth go to their bedrooms and the staff is to use
an upstairs bathroom which means on the same level as the youth
bedrooms.
Social Service Worker/ Complainant was interviewed face-to-face at
the facility on 1/25/2024. Social Service worker reported she was
notified by the school that Youth A was being inappropriate on her
school computer on 1/16/2024. Social Service Worker reported when
Youth A arrived at the facility it was communicated by Foster Care
Worker concerns with Youth A being inappropriate on technology.
Social Service Worker sent out an email to the house staff on Youth A’s
4

second day at the facility notifying staff that Youth A needed to be
supervised at all times when on technology at the facility. Social Service
Worker reported to her knowledge staff have been supervising Youth A
when she has been on a computer at the facility and the concerns with
inappropriate emails and inappropriate websites occurred while Youth A
was at school. Social Service Worker reported she has not been aware
of any concerns of Youth A and Youth B being in a relationship prior to
Youth A disclosing she and Youth B kissed. Youth A is currently only
able to make telephone calls to her caseworkers and Guardian Ad Litem
and these are monitored as of 1/16/2024. Social Service Worker
reported monitored phone calls mean the phone is on speaker with staff
present to listen to the conversation as well as staff dial the phone
number. Social Service Worker was not present at the home on
12/26/2023 to have any firsthand knowledge of the supervision of Youth
A and Youth B.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/25/2024.
Supervisor reported if youth in the house are on computers, staff are to
supervise youth with having staff eyes on the computer screen.
Supervisor reported Youth A has not had computer privileges in a
couple of weeks due to Youth A having her school computer removed
from her by the school due to Youth A inappropriately using the
computer while she was at school. Supervisor reported the facility was
notified by the school that Youth A was sending inappropriate emails at
school. Supervisor was not aware of any times where Youth A has not
been supervised by staff at the facility when she has been on a
computer. Youth A is not allowed to be in her bedroom or in the den
with a computer when she did have computer privileges as she was to
be in the main living area with staff supervising her. Supervisor reported
Youth A also has all phone calls monitored at this time meaning the
phone calls are on speaker so staff can hear the conversation.
Supervisor was informed by Therapist about Youth A and Youth B
having physical contact as Youth A disclosed in therapy. Supervisor
reviewed the video of the incident. Supervisor reported on 12/26/2023
Staff 1 was scheduled with another staff member to work the second
shift however the other staff left early. Staff 1 was the only staff working
at the house with Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1 went to use the
bathroom and Youth A and Youth B were left alone in the living room. In
the video it shows Youth A on Youth B’s lap, and Youth A and Youth B
“grinding on each other” with their clothes on. Supervisor reported he
watched the video a few weeks ago and did not recall all the details.
Supervisor did not recall seeing Youth A on a laptop computer and
Youth A being left unsupervised with the laptop computer. Supervisor
had a verbal reprimand with Staff 1 and discussed expectations of line
of sight.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/25/2024.
Therapist reported there is a computer at the house Youth A does use at
times. Therapist reported Foster Care Worker is very specific on what
Youth A can and can’t do on technology and phone calls. Therapist
reported Youth A was sending inappropriate emails while at school.
5

Therapist did not know of Youth A doing any inappropriate emails or
viewing inappropriate websites at the facility and reported Youth A was
doing this while at school. Therapist reported during a session with
Youth A, Youth A disclosed during Christmas break, she and Youth B
kissed and touched each other outside their clothing. Youth A and
Youth B were the only youth in the house at the time with Staff 1.
Therapist reviewed the video footage and found on 12/26/2023 Staff 1
went downstairs, and Youth A and Youth B were alone in the main living
area of the house. Youth B goes over to Youth A and they began
kissing. Youth B at one point sits in the chair and Youth A straddled
Youth B. Therapist reported Youth A and Youth B hear Staff 1 coming
and stop. Therapist reported the incident lasted for a few minutes.
Therapist notified Supervisor to address the concern.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/25/2024. Chief Administrator reported her understanding is Youth A
was viewing a website at school that contained nude photographs.
Youth A was able to use her school laptop in the facility however staff
were to maintain line of sight on the computer screen to see what Youth
A was doing. Chief Administrator reported she is aware of Youth A
being “over sexualized” toward males. Chief Administrator reported she
was informed of a situation between Youth A and Youth B. Chief
Administrator received a text message from Therapist informing her of
Youth A disclosed information during a therapy session. Therapist
reviewed video footage and Chief Administrator’s understanding of the
situation was Youth A and Youth B were the only two youth in the house
with Staff 1. Staff 1 needed to use the bathroom and while Staff 1 used
the bathroom, Youth A and Youth B kissed and touched one another
over their clothing. Chief Administrator reported she did not know why
another staff was not called to the house to provide supervision while
Staff 1 used the bathroom. Chief Administrator reported there was
knowledge of Youth A having feelings for Youth B prior to the incident
occurring. Chief Administrator reported she had not watched the video
prior to watching the video with Consultant. After becoming aware of
the situation, the facility now has a tablet with the camera footage in live
time so if a staff member needs to step away to use the bathroom, the
staff can watch the tablet to ensure youth whereabouts are known.
Foster Care Worker was interview via telephone on 1/24/2024.
Foster Care Worker reported there have been ongoing concerns with
Youth A being supervised on the telephone at the facility and on
technology. Foster Care Worker informed the facility when Youth A
arrived about the importance of providing supervision on the telephone
and technology as Youth A can be very sneaky and communicate with
individuals she is not supposed to. Within the first two days of Youth A
being at the facility Foster Care Worker became informed that Youth A
was reaching on to individuals that she is not supposed to have contact
with. Youth A has been sending inappropriate nude pictures on her
school Chromebook. Foster Care Worker is unsure if these pictures
were sent while Youth A was at school or at the facility. Youth A had an
incident where she told staff she was calling Foster Care Worker and
6

called a male peer instead. Youth A is not supposed to have the phone
or any technology in her bedroom however is able to. Foster Care
Worker reported the facility has created a great safety plan for Youth A
however staff are not following it. Foster Care Worker is concerned as
Youth A is supposed to be starting online school soon and there is
concern about who will be directly supervising Youth A when she is
doing online schoolwork at the facility. Foster Care Worker reported
when Youth A is on technology at the facility staff are not supervising
her, however it was reported other youth are supervising Youth A on
technology. Foster Care Worker reported concerns as Youth A has a
history of over sexualized behaviors and Youth A has recently reported
to Foster Care Worker her desire to become pregnant as soon as
possible.
Video Review:
Video footage of 2/26/2023 in Cedar Creek living room was reviewed on
1/25/2024. Youth A, Youth B, and Staff 1 are sitting in the living room
watching tv. Youth A has a laptop computer on her lap. Youth A is
sitting to the right of the tv in a chair on the laptop computer with the
computer screen facing her and Staff 1 is sitting in a chair in front of the
tv. Youth B is sitting facing the tv as well. Staff 1 gets up and closes the
staff office door and goes downstairs. Youth A and Youth B are left
alone in the living room. Youth A is alone in the living room with the
laptop computer. Youth A puts the laptop computer down and appears
to be talking to Youth B however there is no sound on the video. Youth
B gets up from where he is sitting and walks over to Youth B. Youth B
stands up. Youth A and Youth B begin kissing and Youth B is touching
Youth A’s groin area on the outside of Youth A’s clothing. Youth A is
also touching Youth B on the outside of his clothing. Youth A and Youth
B engage in kissing and touching each other outside their clothing for
approximately five minutes. Youth A and Youth B separate as Staff 1
comes back upstairs. Staff 1 was downstairs for approximately eight
minutes.
Documents Reviewed:
• Cedar Creek Program Description- Supervision: While in the
group home and on campus, youth are always supervised and in
eyesight of a member of the staff when not in their rooms.
Staffing will be increased as needed to meet the supervision
needs of current youth in the program.
• Teaching Family Homes Technology Usage Policy and
Procedure: A “managed device” meaning it is managed by
Teaching Family Homes staff or having been issued by a local
school system. Youth use of any internet-capable device needs
to be in a public room and monitored by staff.
• Teaching Family Homes Communication Policy: Youth are
permitted to make telephone calls during authorized times.
Telephone calls may be limited to prevent harm to youth.
7

• Email from Social Service Worker to Cedar Creek staff on
11/9/2023: Youth A is not allowed on electronics due to using
them inappropriately. Youth A may only use the house laptop if
a staff is able to sit next to Youth A and monitor her heavily. If
this is not able to happen, Youth A cannot be on the laptop.
• Email exchange between Social Service Worker and Foster Care
Worker on 11/13/2023 stating all phone calls are to be monitored
with the exception of Foster Care Worker, Adoption Worker and
Guardian Ad Litem.
• Behavior Management Plan for Youth A dated 12/6/2023: Youth
A has had inappropriate sexual relationships with peers.
Anticipating triggers that trigger challenging behaviors for Youth
A include when Youth A has lack of supervision. Staff need to
maintain proper supervision of Youth A. Staff must ensure Youth
A has appropriate boundaries with other youth in the home.
Youth A will not be alone with other youth. All phone calls with
exception to caseworkers and Guardian Ad Litem are monitored
until further notice.
• Behavior Management Plan for Youth A dated 1/15/2024: Plan is
consistent with Behavior Management Plan dated 12/6/2023
however has addition information: Youth A has not been
appropriate on the internet. Youth A needs to always report their
whereabouts by knocking, asking to leave/enter their room or the
kitchen. Youth A will not be able to use the house computer.
Youth A will only be allowed on the house computer to download
music when a staff is placed directly next to them to monitor the
internet usage. All telephone calls must be dialed by staff and
staff must confirm the identity of the person called. All telephone
calls must occur in the den. Youth A is only allowed to have
contact with caseworkers and Guardian Ad Litem.
• Behavior Management Plan for Youth A dated 1/23/2024 is
consistent with Behavior Management Plans dated 12/6/2023
and 1/15/2024.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Youth Incident
Report for Youth A dated 12/29/2023: Youth A wanted to call her
caseworker. Staff 1 dialed the phone and gave it to Youth A.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were not aware that youth were no longer
allowed to take unmonitored telephone calls in their bedrooms.
Youth A was informed earlier in the day she was no longer
allowed to have telephone calls in her bedroom. Staff 2
contacted on call supervisor to double check if it was ok for youth
to have unmonitored telephone call in their bedrooms and was
informed it was not and Youth A had been informed of this. Staff
2 went to address this with Youth A and use the Teaching Family
Homes model to teach to the behavior. Staff 2 asked to verify
the caller and it was a male on the phone trying to say he was
Youth A’s caseworker. Staff 2 ended the telephone call.
8

• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Youth Incident
Report for Youth A dated 1/3/2024: Youth A disclosed
inappropriate relations with another youth at the facility and
reported the contact was sexual in nature. Youth A and the other
youth kissed and touch one another on each other’s bodies on
the exterior of each other’s clothing.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Youth Incident
Report for Youth A dated 1/8/2024: School called the facility and
informed the facility Youth A was using inappropriate websites at
school with nude pictures on the website.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Verbal Feedback
document completed by Supervisor stating Staff 1 was provided
verbal feedback about not providing adequate supervision of
youth on 12/26/2023. Supervisor addressed line of sight
supervision and proper bathroom protocol with Staff 1.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Youth Incident
Report for Youth A dated 1/15/2024: Assistant principal called
and informed the facility Youth A would no longer be allowed to
keep her Chromebook between classes or after school due to
Youth A sending sexually explicit emails on the school laptop.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Youth Incident
Report for Youth A dated 1/19/2024: The school reviewed Youth
A’s internet history and found Youth A speaking with a man
online about trying to meet up and get past Teaching Family
Homes security.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Safety Plan for
Youth A and Youth B dated 1/4/2024: A safety plan has been
implemented to prevent any futures incident of Youth A and
Youth B having physical interactions with one another. Staff will
maintain proper supervision when Youth A and Youth B are in
physical proximity of each other in the home. Youth A and Youth
B will not be left alone with each other at any time. Staff will
immediately stand in between Youth A and Youth B if they
interact. Youth A and Youth B will not share a couch at any time
and will sit at opposite ends of a vehicle if in one together. Youth
A and Youth B will not sit next to one another at the table and will
not be in the same hallway. If Youth A or Youth B goes AWOL,
the eyes on supervision of the youth not AWOL will increase.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was one verbal disciplinary
record related to the supervision for the incident in this
special investigation. Staff 1 received training on
supervision of youth on 9/20/2023 during Cedar Creek
Orientation training.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as the facilities internal
policy and procedure for supervision of youth and supervision of
9

youth with computer usage was not followed. Per interviews,
documents reviewed, and video reviewed, on 12/26/2023 Staff 1
left Youth A and Youth B unsupervised as well as Youth A had a
laptop in her possession while unsupervised.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Per the facilities internal policy, youth are to be in staff’s line of
sight at all times when youth are out of their bedrooms. It is
recommended the facility determine a way to ensure their policy is
followed by having sufficient staffing if youth are in different areas
of the house or staff need to use the bathroom or step away from
youth while on shift. The facility has implemented a tablet for staff
to use if the staff does need to step away from the youth as the
tablet will have the live camera system to view youth during this
time. It is recommended the facility implement other measures to
ensure proper supervision of youth as the tablet will not provide
the necessary supervision. The facility is aware Youth A needs
extra supervision per documentation in the safety plan and in
Youth A's behavior management plans and needs to ensure staff
are providing extra supervision of Youth A as per the special
investigation it was found Youth A has not been properly
supervised.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.

sir_summary.summary: The report details a special investigation at Cedar Creek Teaching Family Home, substantiating that a staff member left two youth unsupervised for several minutes, during which they engaged in physical sexual contact. It also found failures in supervising a youth's use of technology, contrary to specific policies and safety plans for that youth. The facility and the staff member, who received verbal reprimand, share culpability for the supervision failures.

sir_violation_level.justification: The report substantiates actual violations involving youth-on-youth physical contact (sexual/kissing) due to lack of supervision, aligning with the 'Safety and Violence' category under severe SIRs. Specifically, Youth A and Youth B engaged in kissing and touching each other's genital areas for several minutes while unsupervised because staff left to use the bathroom. This constitutes physical assault and sexual abuse between youths, raising serious safety risks.
